Bravo, Michael Graff et co.! I recently added simple metrics (healthz, traffic, analysis) for a monitoring service while SLOs were being defined by others. That got me thinking about how to map SLOs <-> SLIs and KPIs <-> metrics <-> registers via OTel collectors (DPU/GPU/CPU HW/SW interfaces, anyone?). But then it got me thinking about how one would monitor dynamic HW/SW elements in a heterogeneous AI Infra fabric, leading to my current investigation of out-of-band management using OpenBMC on an evb-ast2600 board using Qemu-based HW emulation. Chip sounds like an important component in such a solution! And veddy much just in time! Congrats and thanks! ğŸ—ï¸ğŸ¤“ğŸ‰

If youâ€™re new to drafting contracts, here are some tips that will help you avoid some costly mistakes.When it comes to writing contracts, clarity and conciseness rule the day. A poorly drafted contract can not only confuse the parties as to what is expected from whom, but it can also become a litigation quagmire if a later disagreement over the terms results in a lawsuit.Writing contracts and agreements require a meticulous approach. Begin with a clear title and an introduction that identifies the parties and purpose.Define key terms, specify obligations, and outline payment terms, if applicable. Include the contractâ€™s duration, termination conditions, performance standards, and, when necessary, provisions for confidentiality and intellectual property.Clarify liability, indemnification, and the process for dispute resolution, specifying governing law and jurisdiction. Address how amendments will be made, include an entire agreement clause, and outline severability.Provide space for all partiesâ€™ signatures and comply with any notary or witness requirements. Attach relevant documents and have legal counsel review them. Keep copies for reference. Customization is essential, and legal advice is recommended for complex contracts.

If youâ€™re new to drafting contracts, here are some tips that will help you avoid some costly mistakes.When it comes to writing contracts, clarity and conciseness rule the day. A poorly drafted contract can not only confuse the parties as to what is expected from whom, but it can also become a litigation quagmire if a later disagreement over the terms results in a lawsuit.Writing contracts and agreements require a meticulous approach. Begin with a clear title and an introduction that identifies the parties and purpose.Define key terms, specify obligations, and outline payment terms, if applicable. Include the contractâ€™s duration, termination conditions, performance standards, and, when necessary, provisions for confidentiality and intellectual property.Clarify liability, indemnification, and the process for dispute resolution, specifying governing law and jurisdiction. Address how amendments will be made, include an entire agreement clause, and outline severability.Provide space for all partiesâ€™ signatures and comply with any notary or witness requirements. Attach relevant documents and have legal counsel review them. Keep copies for reference. Customization is essential, and legal advice is recommended for complex contracts.

If youâ€™re new to drafting contracts, here are some tips that will help you avoid some costly mistakes.When it comes to writing contracts, clarity and conciseness rule the day. A poorly drafted contract can not only confuse the parties as to what is expected from whom, but it can also become a litigation quagmire if a later disagreement over the terms results in a lawsuit.Writing contracts and agreements require a meticulous approach. Begin with a clear title and an introduction that identifies the parties and purpose.Define key terms, specify obligations, and outline payment terms, if applicable. Include the contractâ€™s duration, termination conditions, performance standards, and, when necessary, provisions for confidentiality and intellectual property.Clarify liability, indemnification, and the process for dispute resolution, specifying governing law and jurisdiction. Address how amendments will be made, include an entire agreement clause, and outline severability.Provide space for all partiesâ€™ signatures and comply with any notary or witness requirements. Attach relevant documents and have legal counsel review them. Keep copies for reference. Customization is essential, and legal advice is recommended for complex contracts.

If youâ€™re new to drafting contracts, here are some tips that will help you avoid some costly mistakes.When it comes to writing contracts, clarity and conciseness rule the day. A poorly drafted contract can not only confuse the parties as to what is expected from whom, but it can also become a litigation quagmire if a later disagreement over the terms results in a lawsuit.Writing contracts and agreements require a meticulous approach. Begin with a clear title and an introduction that identifies the parties and purpose.Define key terms, specify obligations, and outline payment terms, if applicable. Include the contractâ€™s duration, termination conditions, performance standards, and, when necessary, provisions for confidentiality and intellectual property.Clarify liability, indemnification, and the process for dispute resolution, specifying governing law and jurisdiction. Address how amendments will be made, include an entire agreement clause, and outline severability.Provide space for all partiesâ€™ signatures and comply with any notary or witness requirements. Attach relevant documents and have legal counsel review them. Keep copies for reference. Customization is essential, and legal advice is recommended for complex contracts.

If youâ€™re new to drafting contracts, here are some tips that will help you avoid some costly mistakes.When it comes to writing contracts, clarity and conciseness rule the day. A poorly drafted contract can not only confuse the parties as to what is expected from whom, but it can also become a litigation quagmire if a later disagreement over the terms results in a lawsuit.Writing contracts and agreements require a meticulous approach. Begin with a clear title and an introduction that identifies the parties and purpose.Define key terms, specify obligations, and outline payment terms, if applicable. Include the contractâ€™s duration, termination conditions, performance standards, and, when necessary, provisions for confidentiality and intellectual property.Clarify liability, indemnification, and the process for dispute resolution, specifying governing law and jurisdiction. Address how amendments will be made, include an entire agreement clause, and outline severability.Provide space for all partiesâ€™ signatures and comply with any notary or witness requirements. Attach relevant documents and have legal counsel review them. Keep copies for reference. Customization is essential, and legal advice is recommended for complex contracts.

If youâ€™re new to drafting contracts, here are some tips that will help you avoid some costly mistakes.When it comes to writing contracts, clarity and conciseness rule the day. A poorly drafted contract can not only confuse the parties as to what is expected from whom, but it can also become a litigation quagmire if a later disagreement over the terms results in a lawsuit.Writing contracts and agreements require a meticulous approach. Begin with a clear title and an introduction that identifies the parties and purpose.Define key terms, specify obligations, and outline payment terms, if applicable. Include the contractâ€™s duration, termination conditions, performance standards, and, when necessary, provisions for confidentiality and intellectual property.Clarify liability, indemnification, and the process for dispute resolution, specifying governing law and jurisdiction. Address how amendments will be made, include an entire agreement clause, and outline severability.Provide space for all partiesâ€™ signatures and comply with any notary or witness requirements. Attach relevant documents and have legal counsel review them. Keep copies for reference. Customization is essential, and legal advice is recommended for complex contracts.

If youâ€™re new to drafting contracts, here are some tips that will help you avoid some costly mistakes.When it comes to writing contracts, clarity and conciseness rule the day. A poorly drafted contract can not only confuse the parties as to what is expected from whom, but it can also become a litigation quagmire if a later disagreement over the terms results in a lawsuit.Writing contracts and agreements require a meticulous approach. Begin with a clear title and an introduction that identifies the parties and purpose.Define key terms, specify obligations, and outline payment terms, if applicable. Include the contractâ€™s duration, termination conditions, performance standards, and, when necessary, provisions for confidentiality and intellectual property.Clarify liability, indemnification, and the process for dispute resolution, specifying governing law and jurisdiction. Address how amendments will be made, include an entire agreement clause, and outline severability.Provide space for all partiesâ€™ signatures and comply with any notary or witness requirements. Attach relevant documents and have legal counsel review them. Keep copies for reference. Customization is essential, and legal advice is recommended for complex contracts.

If youâ€™re new to drafting contracts, here are some tips that will help you avoid some costly mistakes.When it comes to writing contracts, clarity and conciseness rule the day. A poorly drafted contract can not only confuse the parties as to what is expected from whom, but it can also become a litigation quagmire if a later disagreement over the terms results in a lawsuit.Writing contracts and agreements require a meticulous approach. Begin with a clear title and an introduction that identifies the parties and purpose.Define key terms, specify obligations, and outline payment terms, if applicable. Include the contractâ€™s duration, termination conditions, performance standards, and, when necessary, provisions for confidentiality and intellectual property.Clarify liability, indemnification, and the process for dispute resolution, specifying governing law and jurisdiction. Address how amendments will be made, include an entire agreement clause, and outline severability.Provide space for all partiesâ€™ signatures and comply with any notary or witness requirements. Attach relevant documents and have legal counsel review them. Keep copies for reference. Customization is essential, and legal advice is recommended for complex contracts.

If youâ€™re new to drafting contracts, here are some tips that will help you avoid some costly mistakes.When it comes to writing contracts, clarity and conciseness rule the day. A poorly drafted contract can not only confuse the parties as to what is expected from whom, but it can also become a litigation quagmire if a later disagreement over the terms results in a lawsuit.Writing contracts and agreements require a meticulous approach. Begin with a clear title and an introduction that identifies the parties and purpose.Define key terms, specify obligations, and outline payment terms, if applicable. Include the contractâ€™s duration, termination conditions, performance standards, and, when necessary, provisions for confidentiality and intellectual property.Clarify liability, indemnification, and the process for dispute resolution, specifying governing law and jurisdiction. Address how amendments will be made, include an entire agreement clause, and outline severability.Provide space for all partiesâ€™ signatures and comply with any notary or witness requirements. Attach relevant documents and have legal counsel review them. Keep copies for reference. Customization is essential, and legal advice is recommended for complex contracts.

If youâ€™re new to drafting contracts, here are some tips that will help you avoid some costly mistakes.When it comes to writing contracts, clarity and conciseness rule the day. A poorly drafted contract can not only confuse the parties as to what is expected from whom, but it can also become a litigation quagmire if a later disagreement over the terms results in a lawsuit.Writing contracts and agreements require a meticulous approach. Begin with a clear title and an introduction that identifies the parties and purpose.Define key terms, specify obligations, and outline payment terms, if applicable. Include the contractâ€™s duration, termination conditions, performance standards, and, when necessary, provisions for confidentiality and intellectual property.Clarify liability, indemnification, and the process for dispute resolution, specifying governing law and jurisdiction. Address how amendments will be made, include an entire agreement clause, and outline severability.Provide space for all partiesâ€™ signatures and comply with any notary or witness requirements. Attach relevant documents and have legal counsel review them. Keep copies for reference. Customization is essential, and legal advice is recommended for complex contracts.

If youâ€™re new to drafting contracts, here are some tips that will help you avoid some costly mistakes.When it comes to writing contracts, clarity and conciseness rule the day. A poorly drafted contract can not only confuse the parties as to what is expected from whom, but it can also become a litigation quagmire if a later disagreement over the terms results in a lawsuit.Writing contracts and agreements require a meticulous approach. Begin with a clear title and an introduction that identifies the parties and purpose.Define key terms, specify obligations, and outline payment terms, if applicable. Include the contractâ€™s duration, termination conditions, performance standards, and, when necessary, provisions for confidentiality and intellectual property.Clarify liability, indemnification, and the process for dispute resolution, specifying governing law and jurisdiction. Address how amendments will be made, include an entire agreement clause, and outline severability.Provide space for all partiesâ€™ signatures and comply with any notary or witness requirements. Attach relevant documents and have legal counsel review them. Keep copies for reference. Customization is essential, and legal advice is recommended for complex contracts.

If youâ€™re new to drafting contracts, here are some tips that will help you avoid some costly mistakes.When it comes to writing contracts, clarity and conciseness rule the day. A poorly drafted contract can not only confuse the parties as to what is expected from whom, but it can also become a litigation quagmire if a later disagreement over the terms results in a lawsuit.Writing contracts and agreements require a meticulous approach. Begin with a clear title and an introduction that identifies the parties and purpose.Define key terms, specify obligations, and outline payment terms, if applicable. Include the contractâ€™s duration, termination conditions, performance standards, and, when necessary, provisions for confidentiality and intellectual property.Clarify liability, indemnification, and the process for dispute resolution, specifying governing law and jurisdiction. Address how amendments will be made, include an entire agreement clause, and outline severability.Provide space for all partiesâ€™ signatures and comply with any notary or witness requirements. Attach relevant documents and have legal counsel review them. Keep copies for reference. Customization is essential, and legal advice is recommended for complex contracts.

If youâ€™re new to drafting contracts, here are some tips that will help you avoid some costly mistakes.When it comes to writing contracts, clarity and conciseness rule the day. A poorly drafted contract can not only confuse the parties as to what is expected from whom, but it can also become a litigation quagmire if a later disagreement over the terms results in a lawsuit.Writing contracts and agreements require a meticulous approach. Begin with a clear title and an introduction that identifies the parties and purpose.Define key terms, specify obligations, and outline payment terms, if applicable. Include the contractâ€™s duration, termination conditions, performance standards, and, when necessary, provisions for confidentiality and intellectual property.Clarify liability, indemnification, and the process for dispute resolution, specifying governing law and jurisdiction. Address how amendments will be made, include an entire agreement clause, and outline severability.Provide space for all partiesâ€™ signatures and comply with any notary or witness requirements. Attach relevant documents and have legal counsel review them. Keep copies for reference. Customization is essential, and legal advice is recommended for complex contracts.

This is makes pruning redundant paths very quick as n tends to be small, and m tends to be very large.

If youâ€™re new to drafting contracts, here are some tips that will help you avoid some costly mistakes.When it comes to writing contracts, clarity and conciseness rule the day. A poorly drafted contract can not only confuse the parties as to what is expected from whom, but it can also become a litigation quagmire if a later disagreement over the terms results in a lawsuit.Writing contracts and agreements require a meticulous approach. Begin with a clear title and an introduction that identifies the parties and purpose.Define key terms, specify obligations, and outline payment terms, if applicable. Include the contractâ€™s duration, termination conditions, performance standards, and, when necessary, provisions for confidentiality and intellectual property.Clarify liability, indemnification, and the process for dispute resolution, specifying governing law and jurisdiction. Address how amendments will be made, include an entire agreement clause, and outline severability.Provide space for all partiesâ€™ signatures and comply with any notary or witness requirements. Attach relevant documents and have legal counsel review them. Keep copies for reference. Customization is essential, and legal advice is recommended for complex contracts.

This is makes pruning redundant paths very quick as n tends to be small, and m tends to be very large.

If youâ€™re new to drafting contracts, here are some tips that will help you avoid some costly mistakes.When it comes to writing contracts, clarity and conciseness rule the day. A poorly drafted contract can not only confuse the parties as to what is expected from whom, but it can also become a litigation quagmire if a later disagreement over the terms results in a lawsuit.Writing contracts and agreements require a meticulous approach. Begin with a clear title and an introduction that identifies the parties and purpose.Define key terms, specify obligations, and outline payment terms, if applicable. Include the contractâ€™s duration, termination conditions, performance standards, and, when necessary, provisions for confidentiality and intellectual property.Clarify liability, indemnification, and the process for dispute resolution, specifying governing law and jurisdiction. Address how amendments will be made, include an entire agreement clause, and outline severability.Provide space for all partiesâ€™ signatures and comply with any notary or witness requirements. Attach relevant documents and have legal counsel review them. Keep copies for reference. Customization is essential, and legal advice is recommended for complex contracts.

I wrote a paper about the my implementation, the algorithm, and some new developments; notably, that prime path coverage subsumes MC/DC, and that using suffix trees for recording paths can eliminate redundant paths very quickly -- O(nÂ²m) down from O(nÂ²mÂ²), where n is the length of the longest path, and m is the number of paths. This is makes pruning redundant paths very quick as n tends to be small, and m tends to be very large.

When a request is made (e.g., POST /api/products), the flow goes as follows:1. The API Gateway forwards the request to the Auth Service to validate the JWT.2. if valid, it responds with a 200 OK.3. The Gateway then delegates the request to the appropriate microservice (e.g., Product Catalog).4. Then service checks user permissions and performs the necessary action.This approach ensures that each service remains focused on its core responsibilities while the gateway handles routing and initial auth validation.hashtag#Microservices hashtag#Authentication hashtag#APIGateway hashtag#Security hashtag#SoftwareArchitecture hashtag#backend hashtag#dotnet hashtag#csharp hashtag#nginx

Bravo, Michael Graff et co.! I recently added simple metrics (healthz, traffic, analysis) for a monitoring service while SLOs were being defined by others. That got me thinking about how to map SLOs <-> SLIs and KPIs <-> metrics <-> registers via OTel collectors (DPU/GPU/CPU HW/SW interfaces, anyone?). But then it got me thinking about how one would monitor dynamic HW/SW elements in a heterogeneous AI Infra fabric, leading to my current investigation of out-of-band management using OpenBMC on an evb-ast2600 board using Qemu-based HW emulation. Chip sounds like an important component in such a solution! And veddy much just in time! Congrats and thanks! ğŸ—ï¸ğŸ¤“ğŸ‰

If youâ€™re new to drafting contracts, here are some tips that will help you avoid some costly mistakes.When it comes to writing contracts, clarity and conciseness rule the day. A poorly drafted contract can not only confuse the parties as to what is expected from whom, but it can also become a litigation quagmire if a later disagreement over the terms results in a lawsuit.Writing contracts and agreements require a meticulous approach. Begin with a clear title and an introduction that identifies the parties and purpose.Define key terms, specify obligations, and outline payment terms, if applicable. Include the contractâ€™s duration, termination conditions, performance standards, and, when necessary, provisions for confidentiality and intellectual property.Clarify liability, indemnification, and the process for dispute resolution, specifying governing law and jurisdiction. Address how amendments will be made, include an entire agreement clause, and outline severability.Provide space for all partiesâ€™ signatures and comply with any notary or witness requirements. Attach relevant documents and have legal counsel review them. Keep copies for reference. Customization is essential, and legal advice is recommended for complex contracts.

GCC15 is out, with prime path coverage! I wrote a paper about the my implementation, the algorithm, and some new developments; notably, that prime path coverage subsumes MC/DC, and that using suffix trees for recording paths can eliminate redundant paths very quickly -- O(nÂ²m) down from O(nÂ²mÂ²), where n is the length of the longest path, and m is the number of paths. This is makes pruning redundant paths very quick as n tends to be small, and m tends to be very large.

Up until recently Amethyst Planner stored everything locally on the user's device. Unfortunately this meant that the user couldn't use the app across multiple devices (or easy switch to a new device).I was surprised to find there wasn't an existing plugin for sync'ing data between Hive and a backend API. We ended up creating TimestampedBox that wraps a Hive Box and provides all the timestamps to support the sync operation. What do you think? How have you approached synchronization and reconciliation across devices and backends?Checkout Amethyst Planner - the task app for hashtag#ADHDers the turns to-dos into dopamine.

If youâ€™re new to drafting contracts, here are some tips that will help you avoid some costly mistakes.When it comes to writing contracts, clarity and conciseness rule the day. A poorly drafted contract can not only confuse the parties as to what is expected from whom, but it can also become a litigation quagmire if a later disagreement over the terms results in a lawsuit.Writing contracts and agreements require a meticulous approach. Begin with a clear title and an introduction that identifies the parties and purpose.Define key terms, specify obligations, and outline payment terms, if applicable. Include the contractâ€™s duration, termination conditions, performance standards, and, when necessary, provisions for confidentiality and intellectual property.Clarify liability, indemnification, and the process for dispute resolution, specifying governing law and jurisdiction. Address how amendments will be made, include an entire agreement clause, and outline severability.Provide space for all partiesâ€™ signatures and comply with any notary or witness requirements. Attach relevant documents and have legal counsel review them. Keep copies for reference. Customization is essential, and legal advice is recommended for complex contracts.

GCC15 is out, with prime path coverage! I wrote a paper about the my implementation, the algorithm, and some new developments; notably, that prime path coverage subsumes MC/DC, and that using suffix trees for recording paths can eliminate redundant paths very quickly -- O(nÂ²m) down from O(nÂ²mÂ²), where n is the length of the longest path, and m is the number of paths. This is makes pruning redundant paths very quick as n tends to be small, and m tends to be very large.

Up until recently Amethyst Planner stored everything locally on the user's device. ğ—›ğ—®ğ—»ğ—±ğ—¹ğ—¶ğ—»ğ—´ ğ—”ğ˜‚ğ˜ğ—µğ—²ğ—»ğ˜ğ—¶ğ—°ğ—®ğ˜ğ—¶ğ—¼ğ—» ğ—¶ğ—» ğ— ğ—¶ğ—°ğ—¿ğ—¼ğ˜€ğ—²ğ—¿ğ˜ƒğ—¶ğ—°ğ—²ğ˜€In a microservices architecture, authentication plays a critical role in securing internal communication and enforcing access control.This diagram shows the authentication flow using an API Gateway (like Nginx). When a request is made (e.g., POST /api/products), the flow goes as follows:1. The API Gateway forwards the request to the Auth Service to validate the JWT.2. if valid, it responds with a 200 OK.3. The Gateway then delegates the request to the appropriate microservice (e.g., Product Catalog).4. Then service checks user permissions and performs the necessary action.This approach ensures that each service remains focused on its core responsibilities while the gateway handles routing and initial auth validation.hashtag#Microservices hashtag#Authentication hashtag#APIGateway hashtag#Security hashtag#SoftwareArchitecture hashtag#backend hashtag#dotnet hashtag#csharp hashtag#nginx

Bravo, Michael Graff et co.! I recently added simple metrics (healthz, traffic, analysis) for a monitoring service while SLOs were being defined by others. That got me thinking about how to map SLOs <-> SLIs and KPIs <-> metrics <-> registers via OTel collectors (DPU/GPU/CPU HW/SW interfaces, anyone?). But then it got me thinking about how one would monitor dynamic HW/SW elements in a heterogeneous AI Infra fabric, leading to my current investigation of out-of-band management using OpenBMC on an evb-ast2600 board using Qemu-based HW emulation. Chip sounds like an important component in such a solution! And veddy much just in time! Congrats and thanks! ğŸ—ï¸ğŸ¤“ğŸ‰

If youâ€™re new to drafting contracts, here are some tips that will help you avoid some costly mistakes.When it comes to writing contracts, clarity and conciseness rule the day. A poorly drafted contract can not only confuse the parties as to what is expected from whom, but it can also become a litigation quagmire if a later disagreement over the terms results in a lawsuit.Writing contracts and agreements require a meticulous approach. Begin with a clear title and an introduction that identifies the parties and purpose.Define key terms, specify obligations, and outline payment terms, if applicable. Include the contractâ€™s duration, termination conditions, performance standards, and, when necessary, provisions for confidentiality and intellectual property.Clarify liability, indemnification, and the process for dispute resolution, specifying governing law and jurisdiction. Address how amendments will be made, include an entire agreement clause, and outline severability.Provide space for all partiesâ€™ signatures and comply with any notary or witness requirements. Attach relevant documents and have legal counsel review them. Keep copies for reference. Customization is essential, and legal advice is recommended for complex contracts.

GCC15 is out, with prime path coverage! I wrote a paper about the my implementation, the algorithm, and some new developments; notably, that prime path coverage subsumes MC/DC, and that using suffix trees for recording paths can eliminate redundant paths very quickly -- O(nÂ²m) down from O(nÂ²mÂ²), where n is the length of the longest path, and m is the number of paths. Up until recently Amethyst Planner stored everything locally on the user's device. Unfortunately this meant that the user couldn't use the app across multiple devices (or easy switch to a new device).I was surprised to find there wasn't an existing plugin for sync'ing data between Hive and a backend API. We ended up creating TimestampedBox that wraps a Hive Box and provides all the timestamps to support the sync operation. What do you think? If youâ€™re new to drafting contracts, here are some tips that will help you avoid some costly mistakes.When it comes to writing contracts, clarity and conciseness rule the day. A poorly drafted contract can not only confuse the parties as to what is expected from whom, but it can also become a litigation quagmire if a later disagreement over the terms results in a lawsuit.Writing contracts and agreements require a meticulous approach. Begin with a clear title and an introduction that identifies the parties and purpose.Define key terms, specify obligations, and outline payment terms, if applicable. Include the contractâ€™s duration, termination conditions, performance standards, and, when necessary, provisions for confidentiality and intellectual property.Clarify liability, indemnification, and the process for dispute resolution, specifying governing law and jurisdiction. Address how amendments will be made, include an entire agreement clause, and outline severability.Provide space for all partiesâ€™ signatures and comply with any notary or witness requirements. Attach relevant documents and have legal counsel review them. Keep copies for reference. Customization is essential, and legal advice is recommended for complex contracts.

GCC15 is out, with prime path coverage! I wrote a paper about the my implementation, the algorithm, and some new developments; notably, that prime path coverage subsumes MC/DC, and that using suffix trees for recording paths can eliminate redundant paths very quickly -- O(nÂ²m) down from O(nÂ²mÂ²), where n is the length of the longest path, and m is the number of paths. This is makes pruning redundant paths very quick as n tends to be small, and m tends to be very large.

Up until recently Amethyst Planner stored everything locally on the user's device. Unfortunately this meant that the user couldn't use the app across multiple devices (or easy switch to a new device).I was surprised to find there wasn't an existing plugin for sync'ing data between Hive and a backend API. We ended up creating TimestampedBox that wraps a Hive Box and provides all the timestamps to support the sync operation. What do you think? ğ—›ğ—®ğ—»ğ—±ğ—¹ğ—¶ğ—»ğ—´ ğ—”ğ˜‚ğ˜ğ—µğ—²ğ—»ğ˜ğ—¶ğ—°ğ—®ğ˜ğ—¶ğ—¼ğ—» ğ—¶ğ—» ğ— ğ—¶ğ—°ğ—¿ğ—¼ğ˜€ğ—²ğ—¿ğ˜ƒğ—¶ğ—°ğ—²ğ˜€In a microservices architecture, authentication plays a critical role in securing internal communication and enforcing access control.This diagram shows the authentication flow using an API Gateway (like Nginx). When a request is made (e.g., POST /api/products), the flow goes as follows:1. The API Gateway forwards the request to the Auth Service to validate the JWT.2. if valid, it responds with a 200 OK.3. The Gateway then delegates the request to the appropriate microservice (e.g., Product Catalog).4. Then service checks user permissions and performs the necessary action.This approach ensures that each service remains focused on its core responsibilities while the gateway handles routing and initial auth validation.hashtag#Microservices hashtag#Authentication hashtag#APIGateway hashtag#Security hashtag#SoftwareArchitecture hashtag#backend hashtag#dotnet hashtag#csharp hashtag#nginx

For many developers, firmware is a given, constraints that must be obeyed in production software.Â â€œBare-Metal Embedded C Programmingâ€ ( Packt , 2025) by Israel Ninsaw Gbati demonstrates, at a fundamental level, how coding firmware by directly activating system microcontrollers should be merely another step in the production process.Â Â The book consists of 18 chapters, starting with the basics, then discussing timers and system peripherals, before briefly touching on power management.Â I recommend this for any developer looking to extract the maximum performance from their coding. hashtag#baremetal hashtag#C hashtag#Software hashtag#firmware hashtag#Packt

If youâ€™re new to drafting contracts, here are some tips that will help you avoid some costly mistakes.When it comes to writing contracts, clarity and conciseness rule the day. A poorly drafted contract can not only confuse the parties as to what is expected from whom, but it can also become a litigation quagmire if a later disagreement over the terms results in a lawsuit.Writing contracts and agreements require a meticulous approach. Begin with a clear title and an introduction that identifies the parties and purpose.Define key terms, specify obligations, and outline payment terms, if applicable. Include the contractâ€™s duration, termination conditions, performance standards, and, when necessary, provisions for confidentiality and intellectual property.Clarify liability, indemnification, and the process for dispute resolution, specifying governing law and jurisdiction. Address how amendments will be made, include an entire agreement clause, and outline severability.Provide space for all partiesâ€™ signatures and comply with any notary or witness requirements. Attach relevant documents and have legal counsel review them. Keep copies for reference. Customization is essential, and legal advice is recommended for complex contracts.

GCC15 is out, with prime path coverage! I wrote a paper about the my implementation, the algorithm, and some new developments; notably, that prime path coverage subsumes MC/DC, and that using suffix trees for recording paths can eliminate redundant paths very quickly -- O(nÂ²m) down from O(nÂ²mÂ²), where n is the length of the longest path, and m is the number of paths. This is makes pruning redundant paths very quick as n tends to be small, and m tends to be very large.

Up until recently Amethyst Planner stored everything locally on the user's device. Unfortunately this meant that the user couldn't use the app across multiple devices (or easy switch to a new device).I was surprised to find there wasn't an existing plugin for sync'ing data between Hive and a backend API. We ended up creating TimestampedBox that wraps a Hive Box and provides all the timestamps to support the sync operation. What do you think? ğ—›ğ—®ğ—»ğ—±ğ—¹ğ—¶ğ—»ğ—´ ğ—”ğ˜‚ğ˜ğ—µğ—²ğ—»ğ˜ğ—¶ğ—°ğ—®ğ˜ğ—¶ğ—¼ğ—» ğ—¶ğ—» ğ— ğ—¶ğ—°ğ—¿ğ—¼ğ˜€ğ—²ğ—¿ğ˜ƒğ—¶ğ—°ğ—²ğ˜€In a microservices architecture, authentication plays a critical role in securing internal communication and enforcing access control.This diagram shows the authentication flow using an API Gateway (like Nginx). When a request is made (e.g., POST /api/products), the flow goes as follows:1. The API Gateway forwards the request to the Auth Service to validate the JWT.2. if valid, it responds with a 200 OK.3. The Gateway then delegates the request to the appropriate microservice (e.g., Product Catalog).4. Then service checks user permissions and performs the necessary action.This approach ensures that each service remains focused on its core responsibilities while the gateway handles routing and initial auth validation.hashtag#Microservices hashtag#Authentication hashtag#APIGateway hashtag#Security hashtag#SoftwareArchitecture hashtag#backend hashtag#dotnet hashtag#csharp hashtag#nginx

If youâ€™re new to drafting contracts, here are some tips that will help you avoid some costly mistakes.When it comes to writing contracts, clarity and conciseness rule the day. A poorly drafted contract can not only confuse the parties as to what is expected from whom, but it can also become a litigation quagmire if a later disagreement over the terms results in a lawsuit.Writing contracts and agreements require a meticulous approach. Begin with a clear title and an introduction that identifies the parties and purpose.Define key terms, specify obligations, and outline payment terms, if applicable. Include the contractâ€™s duration, termination conditions, performance standards, and, when necessary, provisions for confidentiality and intellectual property.Clarify liability, indemnification, and the process for dispute resolution, specifying governing law and jurisdiction. Address how amendments will be made, include an entire agreement clause, and outline severability.Provide space for all partiesâ€™ signatures and comply with any notary or witness requirements. Attach relevant documents and have legal counsel review them. Keep copies for reference. Customization is essential, and legal advice is recommended for complex contracts.

welcome back Ø¹Ø¯Ù†Ø§ Ø¨Ø¹Ø¯ Ø§Ù„ØºÙŠØ¨Ø© ğŸ˜… ğŸš€ Next Step: SWE.2 â€“ From Requirement to Architecture and Model! ğŸš€Iâ€™m thrilled to share the next phase of my MBD diploma project from OS-Academy â€“ : SWE.2 â€“ Software Architecture Design! ğŸš€In this stage, weâ€™ll take the system requirements defined in SWE.1 and build a modular, maintainable architecture that steers implementation, testing, and future evolution.Hereâ€™s what to expect:1ï¸âƒ£ Architectural Views Break the system into clear functional blocks and define their responsibilities:ğŸ”¹Main State Machine Manages core logic and coordinates inter-module communication.ğŸ”¹Current Limits Calculator Computes safe charge/discharge thresholds based on real-time data.ğŸ”¹SOC & SOH Estimators Tracks battery state-of-charge and state-of-health.ğŸ”¹Balancing Logic Ensures individual cell voltages stay synchronized.2ï¸âƒ£ Interfaces & Data FlowsMap each domain into software modules/packages with precise contracts: ğŸ”¹ Defined fixed-rate tasks(50 ms â” MainSM, 100 ms â” LimitsCalc, 200 ms â” SOC/SOH estimators, 250 ms â” Balancing) ğŸ”¹ Route signals (voltage, temperature, current) via buses and ZOH blocks ğŸ”¹ Store each signal in the Data Dictionary as ğŸ”„ a MTP Signals: (ImportedExtern (inputs) - ExportedToFile (logging) - Localized (module-internal))3ï¸âƒ£ Modeling & PrototypingLeverage MATLAB/Simulink & Stateflow to:ğŸ”¹Prototype each core module and simulate their interactions.ğŸ”¹Auto-generate architecture diagrams directly from models.ğŸ”¹Run Model Advisor checks for MISRA C compliance, execution efficiency, and RAM usage.4ï¸âƒ£ Verification AlignmentEmbed test hooks and traceability throughout:ğŸ”¹MIL/SIL Test Harnesses for unit, integration, and system-level validation.ğŸ”¹Full Requirements â†” Architecture â†” Test Case traceability matrices.ğŸ”¹Automated test-management reports to track coverage and results.ğŸ” Why it matters A well-crafted software architecture is the backbone of a reliable project â€”it makes implementation easier to develop, verify, and evolve. GCC15 is out, with prime path coverage! I wrote a paper about the my implementation, the algorithm, and some new developments; notably, that prime path coverage subsumes MC/DC, and that using suffix trees for recording paths can eliminate redundant paths very quickly -- O(nÂ²m) down from O(nÂ²mÂ²), where n is the length of the longest path, and m is the number of paths. This is makes pruning redundant paths very quick as n tends to be small, and m tends to be very large.

Up until recently Amethyst Planner stored everything locally on the user's device. Unfortunately this meant that the user couldn't use the app across multiple devices (or easy switch to a new device).I was surprised to find there wasn't an existing plugin for sync'ing data between Hive and a backend API. We ended up creating TimestampedBox that wraps a Hive Box and provides all the timestamps to support the sync operation. What do you think? When a request is made (e.g., POST /api/products), the flow goes as follows:1. The API Gateway forwards the request to the Auth Service to validate the JWT.2. if valid, it responds with a 200 OK.3. The Gateway then delegates the request to the appropriate microservice (e.g., Product Catalog).4. Then service checks user permissions and performs the necessary action.This approach ensures that each service remains focused on its core responsibilities while the gateway handles routing and initial auth validation.hashtag#Microservices hashtag#Authentication hashtag#APIGateway hashtag#Security hashtag#SoftwareArchitecture hashtag#backend hashtag#dotnet hashtag#csharp hashtag#nginx

If youâ€™re new to drafting contracts, here are some tips that will help you avoid some costly mistakes.When it comes to writing contracts, clarity and conciseness rule the day. A poorly drafted contract can not only confuse the parties as to what is expected from whom, but it can also become a litigation quagmire if a later disagreement over the terms results in a lawsuit.Writing contracts and agreements require a meticulous approach. Begin with a clear title and an introduction that identifies the parties and purpose.Define key terms, specify obligations, and outline payment terms, if applicable. Include the contractâ€™s duration, termination conditions, performance standards, and, when necessary, provisions for confidentiality and intellectual property.Clarify liability, indemnification, and the process for dispute resolution, specifying governing law and jurisdiction. Address how amendments will be made, include an entire agreement clause, and outline severability.Provide space for all partiesâ€™ signatures and comply with any notary or witness requirements. Attach relevant documents and have legal counsel review them. Keep copies for reference. Customization is essential, and legal advice is recommended for complex contracts.

ğŸš€In this stage, weâ€™ll take the system requirements defined in SWE.1 and build a modular, maintainable architecture that steers implementation, testing, and future evolution.Hereâ€™s what to expect:1ï¸âƒ£ Architectural Views Break the system into clear functional blocks and define their responsibilities:ğŸ”¹Main State Machine Manages core logic and coordinates inter-module communication.ğŸ”¹Current Limits Calculator Computes safe charge/discharge thresholds based on real-time data.ğŸ”¹SOC & SOH Estimators Tracks battery state-of-charge and state-of-health.ğŸ”¹Balancing Logic Ensures individual cell voltages stay synchronized.2ï¸âƒ£ Interfaces & Data FlowsMap each domain into software modules/packages with precise contracts: ğŸ”¹ Defined fixed-rate tasks(50 ms â” MainSM, 100 ms â” LimitsCalc, 200 ms â” SOC/SOH estimators, 250 ms â” Balancing) ğŸ”¹ Route signals (voltage, temperature, current) via buses and ZOH blocks ğŸ”¹ Store each signal in the Data Dictionary as ğŸ”„ a MTP Signals: (ImportedExtern (inputs) - ExportedToFile (logging) - Localized (module-internal))3ï¸âƒ£ Modeling & PrototypingLeverage MATLAB/Simulink & Stateflow to:ğŸ”¹Prototype each core module and simulate their interactions.ğŸ”¹Auto-generate architecture diagrams directly from models.ğŸ”¹Run Model Advisor checks for MISRA C compliance, execution efficiency, and RAM usage.4ï¸âƒ£ Verification AlignmentEmbed test hooks and traceability throughout:ğŸ”¹MIL/SIL Test Harnesses for unit, integration, and system-level validation.ğŸ”¹Full Requirements â†” Architecture â†” Test Case traceability matrices.ğŸ”¹Automated test-management reports to track coverage and results.ğŸ” Why it matters A well-crafted software architecture is the backbone of a reliable project â€”it makes implementation easier to develop, verify, and evolve. GCC15 is out, with prime path coverage! I wrote a paper about the my implementation, the algorithm, and some new developments; notably, that prime path coverage subsumes MC/DC, and that using suffix trees for recording paths can eliminate redundant paths very quickly -- O(nÂ²m) down from O(nÂ²mÂ²), where n is the length of the longest path, and m is the number of paths. This is makes pruning redundant paths very quick as n tends to be small, and m tends to be very large.

Up until recently Amethyst Planner stored everything locally on the user's device. Unfortunately this meant that the user couldn't use the app across multiple devices (or easy switch to a new device).I was surprised to find there wasn't an existing plugin for sync'ing data between Hive and a backend API. We ended up creating TimestampedBox that wraps a Hive Box and provides all the timestamps to support the sync operation. What do you think? When a request is made (e.g., POST /api/products), the flow goes as follows:1. The API Gateway forwards the request to the Auth Service to validate the JWT.2. if valid, it responds with a 200 OK.3. The Gateway then delegates the request to the appropriate microservice (e.g., Product Catalog).4. Then service checks user permissions and performs the necessary action.This approach ensures that each service remains focused on its core responsibilities while the gateway handles routing and initial auth validation.hashtag#Microservices hashtag#Authentication hashtag#APIGateway hashtag#Security hashtag#SoftwareArchitecture hashtag#backend hashtag#dotnet hashtag#csharp hashtag#nginx

If youâ€™re new to drafting contracts, here are some tips that will help you avoid some costly mistakes.When it comes to writing contracts, clarity and conciseness rule the day. A poorly drafted contract can not only confuse the parties as to what is expected from whom, but it can also become a litigation quagmire if a later disagreement over the terms results in a lawsuit.Writing contracts and agreements require a meticulous approach. Begin with a clear title and an introduction that identifies the parties and purpose.Define key terms, specify obligations, and outline payment terms, if applicable. Include the contractâ€™s duration, termination conditions, performance standards, and, when necessary, provisions for confidentiality and intellectual property.Clarify liability, indemnification, and the process for dispute resolution, specifying governing law and jurisdiction. Address how amendments will be made, include an entire agreement clause, and outline severability.Provide space for all partiesâ€™ signatures and comply with any notary or witness requirements. Attach relevant documents and have legal counsel review them. Keep copies for reference. Customization is essential, and legal advice is recommended for complex contracts.

Can you really get hired from anywhere in the world?As I learnt, it's one of the toughest questions to answer in the recruitment world. The details are fuzzy, bias is always seeping into the supposedly fair assessment of equal employment opportunities (spoiler alert!), and we sort of... just roll with the punches in Africa.I enjoyed exploring this question with knowledgeable folks and wonderful community who shared their experiences with me, and pitched this story in the first place.Let's make Digital Nomads even better.I'm looking to explore more topical issues around housing, economy, and tech in African hubs and how nomads impact these different dimensions.Let's talk hashtag#Nomads; send a message.And ohâ€”the answer to the question I opened with is more systemic and rather circumstantial than I'd imagined. GCC15 is out, with prime path coverage! I wrote a paper about the my implementation, the algorithm, and some new developments; notably, that prime path coverage subsumes MC/DC, and that using suffix trees for recording paths can eliminate redundant paths very quickly -- O(nÂ²m) down from O(nÂ²mÂ²), where n is the length of the longest path, and m is the number of paths. This is makes pruning redundant paths very quick as n tends to be small, and m tends to be very large.

Up until recently Amethyst Planner stored everything locally on the user's device. Unfortunately this meant that the user couldn't use the app across multiple devices (or easy switch to a new device).I was surprised to find there wasn't an existing plugin for sync'ing data between Hive and a backend API. We ended up creating TimestampedBox that wraps a Hive Box and provides all the timestamps to support the sync operation. What do you think? How have you approached synchronization and reconciliation across devices and backends?Checkout Amethyst Planner - the task app for hashtag#ADHDers the turns to-dos into dopamine.

ğ—›ğ—®ğ—»ğ—±ğ—¹ğ—¶ğ—»ğ—´ ğ—”ğ˜‚ğ˜ğ—µğ—²ğ—»ğ˜ğ—¶ğ—°ğ—®ğ˜ğ—¶ğ—¼ğ—» ğ—¶ğ—» ğ— ğ—¶ğ—°ğ—¿ğ—¼ğ˜€ğ—²ğ—¿ğ˜ƒğ—¶ğ—°ğ—²ğ˜€In a microservices architecture, authentication plays a critical role in securing internal communication and enforcing access control.This diagram shows the authentication flow using an API Gateway (like Nginx). When a request is made (e.g., POST /api/products), the flow goes as follows:1. The API Gateway forwards the request to the Auth Service to validate the JWT.2. if valid, it responds with a 200 OK.3. The Gateway then delegates the request to the appropriate microservice (e.g., Product Catalog).4. Then service checks user permissions and performs the necessary action.This approach ensures that each service remains focused on its core responsibilities while the gateway handles routing and initial auth validation.hashtag#Microservices hashtag#Authentication hashtag#APIGateway hashtag#Security hashtag#SoftwareArchitecture hashtag#backend hashtag#dotnet hashtag#csharp hashtag#nginx

For many developers, firmware is a given, constraints that must be obeyed in production software.Â â€œBare-Metal Embedded C Programmingâ€ ( Packt , 2025) by Israel Ninsaw Gbati demonstrates, at a fundamental level, how coding firmware by directly activating system microcontrollers should be merely another step in the production process.Â Â The book consists of 18 chapters, starting with the basics, then discussing timers and system peripherals, before briefly touching on power management.Â I recommend this for any developer looking to extract the maximum performance from their coding. hashtag#baremetal hashtag#C hashtag#Software hashtag#firmware hashtag#Packt

If youâ€™re new to drafting contracts, here are some tips that will help you avoid some costly mistakes.When it comes to writing contracts, clarity and conciseness rule the day. A poorly drafted contract can not only confuse the parties as to what is expected from whom, but it can also become a litigation quagmire if a later disagreement over the terms results in a lawsuit.Writing contracts and agreements require a meticulous approach. Begin with a clear title and an introduction that identifies the parties and purpose.Define key terms, specify obligations, and outline payment terms, if applicable. Include the contractâ€™s duration, termination conditions, performance standards, and, when necessary, provisions for confidentiality and intellectual property.Clarify liability, indemnification, and the process for dispute resolution, specifying governing law and jurisdiction. Address how amendments will be made, include an entire agreement clause, and outline severability.Provide space for all partiesâ€™ signatures and comply with any notary or witness requirements. Attach relevant documents and have legal counsel review them. Keep copies for reference. Customization is essential, and legal advice is recommended for complex contracts.

GCC15 is out, with prime path coverage! I wrote a paper about the my implementation, the algorithm, and some new developments; notably, that prime path coverage subsumes MC/DC, and that using suffix trees for recording paths can eliminate redundant paths very quickly -- O(nÂ²m) down from O(nÂ²mÂ²), where n is the length of the longest path, and m is the number of paths. This is makes pruning redundant paths very quick as n tends to be small, and m tends to be very large.

Up until recently Amethyst Planner stored everything locally on the user's device. Unfortunately this meant that the user couldn't use the app across multiple devices (or easy switch to a new device).I was surprised to find there wasn't an existing plugin for sync'ing data between Hive and a backend API. We ended up creating TimestampedBox that wraps a Hive Box and provides all the timestamps to support the sync operation. What do you think? ğ—›ğ—®ğ—»ğ—±ğ—¹ğ—¶ğ—»ğ—´ ğ—”ğ˜‚ğ˜ğ—µğ—²ğ—»ğ˜ğ—¶ğ—°ğ—®ğ˜ğ—¶ğ—¼ğ—» ğ—¶ğ—» ğ— ğ—¶ğ—°ğ—¿ğ—¼ğ˜€ğ—²ğ—¿ğ˜ƒğ—¶ğ—°ğ—²ğ˜€In a microservices architecture, authentication plays a critical role in securing internal communication and enforcing access control.This diagram shows the authentication flow using an API Gateway (like Nginx). When a request is made (e.g., POST /api/products), the flow goes as follows:1. The API Gateway forwards the request to the Auth Service to validate the JWT.2. if valid, it responds with a 200 OK.3. The Gateway then delegates the request to the appropriate microservice (e.g., Product Catalog).4. Then service checks user permissions and performs the necessary action.This approach ensures that each service remains focused on its core responsibilities while the gateway handles routing and initial auth validation.hashtag#Microservices hashtag#Authentication hashtag#APIGateway hashtag#Security hashtag#SoftwareArchitecture hashtag#backend hashtag#dotnet hashtag#csharp hashtag#nginx

For many developers, firmware is a given, constraints that must be obeyed in production software.Â â€œBare-Metal Embedded C Programmingâ€ ( Packt , 2025) by Israel Ninsaw Gbati demonstrates, at a fundamental level, how coding firmware by directly activating system microcontrollers should be merely another step in the production process.Â Â The book consists of 18 chapters, starting with the basics, then discussing timers and system peripherals, before briefly touching on power management.Â I recommend this for any developer looking to extract the maximum performance from their coding. hashtag#baremetal hashtag#C hashtag#Software hashtag#firmware hashtag#Packt

If youâ€™re new to drafting contracts, here are some tips that will help you avoid some costly mistakes.When it comes to writing contracts, clarity and conciseness rule the day. A poorly drafted contract can not only confuse the parties as to what is expected from whom, but it can also become a litigation quagmire if a later disagreement over the terms results in a lawsuit.Writing contracts and agreements require a meticulous approach. Begin with a clear title and an introduction that identifies the parties and purpose.Define key terms, specify obligations, and outline payment terms, if applicable. Include the contractâ€™s duration, termination conditions, performance standards, and, when necessary, provisions for confidentiality and intellectual property.Clarify liability, indemnification, and the process for dispute resolution, specifying governing law and jurisdiction. Address how amendments will be made, include an entire agreement clause, and outline severability.Provide space for all partiesâ€™ signatures and comply with any notary or witness requirements. Attach relevant documents and have legal counsel review them. Keep copies for reference. Customization is essential, and legal advice is recommended for complex contracts.

Can you really get hired from anywhere in the world?As I learnt, it's one of the toughest questions to answer in the recruitment world. The details are fuzzy, bias is always seeping into the supposedly fair assessment of equal employment opportunities (spoiler alert!), and we sort of... just roll with the punches in Africa.I enjoyed exploring this question with knowledgeable folks and wonderful community who shared their experiences with me, and pitched this story in the first place.Let's make Digital Nomads even better.I'm looking to explore more topical issues around housing, economy, and tech in African hubs and how nomads impact these different dimensions.Let's talk hashtag#Nomads; send a message.And ohâ€”the answer to the question I opened with is more systemic and rather circumstantial than I'd imagined. What are the odds for Africans living and working from the continent?I talk about it here: https://lnkd.in/dRwmT3V7What's your experience with "location-adjusted" pay?

GCC15 is out, with prime path coverage! I wrote a paper about the my implementation, the algorithm, and some new developments; notably, that prime path coverage subsumes MC/DC, and that using suffix trees for recording paths can eliminate redundant paths very quickly -- O(nÂ²m) down from O(nÂ²mÂ²), where n is the length of the longest path, and m is the number of paths. This is makes pruning redundant paths very quick as n tends to be small, and m tends to be very large.

Up until recently Amethyst Planner stored everything locally on the user's device. Unfortunately this meant that the user couldn't use the app across multiple devices (or easy switch to a new device).I was surprised to find there wasn't an existing plugin for sync'ing data between Hive and a backend API. We ended up creating TimestampedBox that wraps a Hive Box and provides all the timestamps to support the sync operation. What do you think? How have you approached synchronization and reconciliation across devices and backends?Checkout Amethyst Planner - the task app for hashtag#ADHDers the turns to-dos into dopamine.

ğ—›ğ—®ğ—»ğ—±ğ—¹ğ—¶ğ—»ğ—´ ğ—”ğ˜‚ğ˜ğ—µğ—²ğ—»ğ˜ğ—¶ğ—°ğ—®ğ˜ğ—¶ğ—¼ğ—» ğ—¶ğ—» ğ— ğ—¶ğ—°ğ—¿ğ—¼ğ˜€ğ—²ğ—¿ğ˜ƒğ—¶ğ—°ğ—²ğ˜€In a microservices architecture, authentication plays a critical role in securing internal communication and enforcing access control.This diagram shows the authentication flow using an API Gateway (like Nginx). When a request is made (e.g., POST /api/products), the flow goes as follows:1. The API Gateway forwards the request to the Auth Service to validate the JWT.2. if valid, it responds with a 200 OK.3. The Gateway then delegates the request to the appropriate microservice (e.g., Product Catalog).4. Then service checks user permissions and performs the necessary action.This approach ensures that each service remains focused on its core responsibilities while the gateway handles routing and initial auth validation.hashtag#Microservices hashtag#Authentication hashtag#APIGateway hashtag#Security hashtag#SoftwareArchitecture hashtag#backend hashtag#dotnet hashtag#csharp hashtag#nginx

For many developers, firmware is a given, constraints that must be obeyed in production software.Â â€œBare-Metal Embedded C Programmingâ€ ( Packt , 2025) by Israel Ninsaw Gbati demonstrates, at a fundamental level, how coding firmware by directly activating system microcontrollers should be merely another step in the production process.Â Â The book consists of 18 chapters, starting with the basics, then discussing timers and system peripherals, before briefly touching on power management.Â I recommend this for any developer looking to extract the maximum performance from their coding. hashtag#baremetal hashtag#C hashtag#Software hashtag#firmware hashtag#Packt

If youâ€™re new to drafting contracts, here are some tips that will help you avoid some costly mistakes.When it comes to writing contracts, clarity and conciseness rule the day. A poorly drafted contract can not only confuse the parties as to what is expected from whom, but it can also become a litigation quagmire if a later disagreement over the terms results in a lawsuit.Writing contracts and agreements require a meticulous approach. Begin with a clear title and an introduction that identifies the parties and purpose.Define key terms, specify obligations, and outline payment terms, if applicable. Include the contractâ€™s duration, termination conditions, performance standards, and, when necessary, provisions for confidentiality and intellectual property.Clarify liability, indemnification, and the process for dispute resolution, specifying governing law and jurisdiction. Address how amendments will be made, include an entire agreement clause, and outline severability.Provide space for all partiesâ€™ signatures and comply with any notary or witness requirements. Attach relevant documents and have legal counsel review them. Keep copies for reference. Customization is essential, and legal advice is recommended for complex contracts.

GCC15 is out, with prime path coverage! I wrote a paper about the my implementation, the algorithm, and some new developments; notably, that prime path coverage subsumes MC/DC, and that using suffix trees for recording paths can eliminate redundant paths very quickly -- O(nÂ²m) down from O(nÂ²mÂ²), where n is the length of the longest path, and m is the number of paths. This is makes pruning redundant paths very quick as n tends to be small, and m tends to be very large.

Up until recently Amethyst Planner stored everything locally on the user's device. Unfortunately this meant that the user couldn't use the app across multiple devices (or easy switch to a new device).I was surprised to find there wasn't an existing plugin for sync'ing data between Hive and a backend API. We ended up creating TimestampedBox that wraps a Hive Box and provides all the timestamps to support the sync operation. What do you think? ğ—›ğ—®ğ—»ğ—±ğ—¹ğ—¶ğ—»ğ—´ ğ—”ğ˜‚ğ˜ğ—µğ—²ğ—»ğ˜ğ—¶ğ—°ğ—®ğ˜ğ—¶ğ—¼ğ—» ğ—¶ğ—» ğ— ğ—¶ğ—°ğ—¿ğ—¼ğ˜€ğ—²ğ—¿ğ˜ƒğ—¶ğ—°ğ—²ğ˜€In a microservices architecture, authentication plays a critical role in securing internal communication and enforcing access control.This diagram shows the authentication flow using an API Gateway (like Nginx). When a request is made (e.g., POST /api/products), the flow goes as follows:1. The API Gateway forwards the request to the Auth Service to validate the JWT.2. if valid, it responds with a 200 OK.3. The Gateway then delegates the request to the appropriate microservice (e.g., Product Catalog).4. Then service checks user permissions and performs the necessary action.This approach ensures that each service remains focused on its core responsibilities while the gateway handles routing and initial auth validation.hashtag#Microservices hashtag#Authentication hashtag#APIGateway hashtag#Security hashtag#SoftwareArchitecture hashtag#backend hashtag#dotnet hashtag#csharp hashtag#nginx

For many developers, firmware is a given, constraints that must be obeyed in production software.Â â€œBare-Metal Embedded C Programmingâ€ ( Packt , 2025) by Israel Ninsaw Gbati demonstrates, at a fundamental level, how coding firmware by directly activating system microcontrollers should be merely another step in the production process.Â Â The book consists of 18 chapters, starting with the basics, then discussing timers and system peripherals, before briefly touching on power management.Â I recommend this for any developer looking to extract the maximum performance from their coding. hashtag#baremetal hashtag#C hashtag#Software hashtag#firmware hashtag#Packt

Java 24: More than an update â€” a powerful step forward for modern software architecture. hashtag#LinkedInInsiderBRWith the official release of Java 24, Oracle continues to evolve the platform in ways that directly support today's demands for scalability, modularity, and cloud-native design. For professionals like me who architect systems with Hexagonal Architecture (DDD) and deploy on AWS, this release brings substantial benefits.ğŸš€ Key Features in Java 24:âœ… JEP 447 â€“ Statements before super(...) Allows initialization logic before calling the superclass constructor. This enhances flexibility in rich domain models and simplifies base-class inheritance patterns in DDD.âœ… JEP 456 â€“ Unnamed Variables and Patterns (Preview) Reduces boilerplate when using pattern matching, making business logic cleaner and more expressive.âœ… JEP 459 â€“ String Templates (Second Preview) Provides safe and efficient string interpolation â€” ideal for building dynamic responses, configurations, and messages without complex concatenation.âœ… JEP 460 â€“ Vector API (7th Incubator) Enables data-parallel operations for better performance in compute-heavy tasks â€” relevant for analytics or event-driven systems.âœ… JEP 462 â€“ Structured Concurrency (Second Preview) Improves thread lifecycle management and simplifies parallel processing. This is huge for backend services needing concurrency without chaos â€” perfect fit for services deployed via AWS Lambda, ECS, or EKS.ğŸ§± How this strengthens Hexagonal Architecture and DDDJava 24â€™s cleaner syntax and enhanced language constructs allow for: ğŸ”¹ Richer domain modeling without ceremony ğŸ”¹ Easier testing and mocking of application ports ğŸ”¹ Clearer separation of concerns in inbound/outbound adapters ğŸ”¹ Better observability and tracing when paired with AWS services like CloudWatch & X-Rayâ˜ï¸ AWS + Java 24 = Cloud-native powerCombined with AWS, Java 24 enables: âœ… Lighter Lambda functions (faster cold starts with JDK optimizations) âœ… Enhanced developer productivity with CodeWhisperer and Amazon Q Developer âœ… Seamless integration with infrastructure-as-code (CDK, Terraform) and microservices ecosystemsWeâ€™re not just writing code â€” weâ€™re building resilient, scalable ecosystems. Java 24 gives us sharper tools to do that smarter, faster, and cleaner.Are you already experimenting with Java 24? Whatâ€™s your favorite improvement so far?hashtag#Java24 hashtag#HexagonalArchitecture hashtag#DDD hashtag#SoftwareArchitecture hashtag#AWS hashtag#CloudNative hashtag#Innovation hashtag#BackendEngineering hashtag#Leadership hashtag#LinkedInInsiderBR

Bravo, Michael Graff et co.! I recently added simple metrics (healthz, traffic, analysis) for a monitoring service while SLOs were being defined by others. That got me thinking about how to map SLOs <-> SLIs and KPIs <-> metrics <-> registers via OTel collectors (DPU/GPU/CPU HW/SW interfaces, anyone?). But then it got me thinking about how one would monitor dynamic HW/SW elements in a heterogeneous AI Infra fabric, leading to my current investigation of out-of-band management using OpenBMC on an evb-ast2600 board using Qemu-based HW emulation. Chip sounds like an important component in such a solution! And veddy much just in time! Congrats and thanks! ğŸ—ï¸ğŸ¤“ğŸ‰

If youâ€™re new to drafting contracts, here are some tips that will help you avoid some costly mistakes.When it comes to writing contracts, clarity and conciseness rule the day. A poorly drafted contract can not only confuse the parties as to what is expected from whom, but it can also become a litigation quagmire if a later disagreement over the terms results in a lawsuit.Writing contracts and agreements require a meticulous approach. Begin with a clear title and an introduction that identifies the parties and purpose.Define key terms, specify obligations, and outline payment terms, if applicable. Include the contractâ€™s duration, termination conditions, performance standards, and, when necessary, provisions for confidentiality and intellectual property.Clarify liability, indemnification, and the process for dispute resolution, specifying governing law and jurisdiction. Address how amendments will be made, include an entire agreement clause, and outline severability.Provide space for all partiesâ€™ signatures and comply with any notary or witness requirements. Attach relevant documents and have legal counsel review them. Keep copies for reference. Customization is essential, and legal advice is recommended for complex contracts.

GCC15 is out, with prime path coverage! I wrote a paper about the my implementation, the algorithm, and some new developments; notably, that prime path coverage subsumes MC/DC, and that using suffix trees for recording paths can eliminate redundant paths very quickly -- O(nÂ²m) down from O(nÂ²mÂ²), where n is the length of the longest path, and m is the number of paths. This is makes pruning redundant paths very quick as n tends to be small, and m tends to be very large.

Up until recently Amethyst Planner stored everything locally on the user's device. Unfortunately this meant that the user couldn't use the app across multiple devices (or easy switch to a new device).I was surprised to find there wasn't an existing plugin for sync'ing data between Hive and a backend API. We ended up creating TimestampedBox that wraps a Hive Box and provides all the timestamps to support the sync operation. What do you think? How have you approached synchronization and reconciliation across devices and backends?Checkout Amethyst Planner - the task app for hashtag#ADHDers the turns to-dos into dopamine.

ğ—›ğ—®ğ—»ğ—±ğ—¹ğ—¶ğ—»ğ—´ ğ—”ğ˜‚ğ˜ğ—µğ—²ğ—»ğ˜ğ—¶ğ—°ğ—®ğ˜ğ—¶ğ—¼ğ—» ğ—¶ğ—» ğ— ğ—¶ğ—°ğ—¿ğ—¼ğ˜€ğ—²ğ—¿ğ˜ƒğ—¶ğ—°ğ—²ğ˜€In a microservices architecture, authentication plays a critical role in securing internal communication and enforcing access control.This diagram shows the authentication flow using an API Gateway (like Nginx). When a request is made (e.g., POST /api/products), the flow goes as follows:1. The API Gateway forwards the request to the Auth Service to validate the JWT.2. if valid, it responds with a 200 OK.3. The Gateway then delegates the request to the appropriate microservice (e.g., Product Catalog).4. Then service checks user permissions and performs the necessary action.This approach ensures that each service remains focused on its core responsibilities while the gateway handles routing and initial auth validation.hashtag#Microservices hashtag#Authentication hashtag#APIGateway hashtag#Security hashtag#SoftwareArchitecture hashtag#backend hashtag#dotnet hashtag#csharp hashtag#nginx

For many developers, firmware is a given, constraints that must be obeyed in production software.Â â€œBare-Metal Embedded C Programmingâ€ ( Packt , 2025) by Israel Ninsaw Gbati demonstrates, at a fundamental level, how coding firmware by directly activating system microcontrollers should be merely another step in the production process.Â Â The book consists of 18 chapters, starting with the basics, then discussing timers and system peripherals, before briefly touching on power management.Â I recommend this for any developer looking to extract the maximum performance from their coding. hashtag#baremetal hashtag#C hashtag#Software hashtag#firmware hashtag#Packt

Java 24: More than an update â€” a powerful step forward for modern software architecture. hashtag#LinkedInInsiderBRWith the official release of Java 24, Oracle continues to evolve the platform in ways that directly support today's demands for scalability, modularity, and cloud-native design. For professionals like me who architect systems with Hexagonal Architecture (DDD) and deploy on AWS, this release brings substantial benefits.ğŸš€ Key Features in Java 24:âœ… JEP 447 â€“ Statements before super(...) Allows initialization logic before calling the superclass constructor. This enhances flexibility in rich domain models and simplifies base-class inheritance patterns in DDD.âœ… JEP 456 â€“ Unnamed Variables and Patterns (Preview) Reduces boilerplate when using pattern matching, making business logic cleaner and more expressive.âœ… JEP 459 â€“ String Templates (Second Preview) Provides safe and efficient string interpolation â€” ideal for building dynamic responses, configurations, and messages without complex concatenation.âœ… JEP 460 â€“ Vector API (7th Incubator) Enables data-parallel operations for better performance in compute-heavy tasks â€” relevant for analytics or event-driven systems.âœ… JEP 462 â€“ Structured Concurrency (Second Preview) Improves thread lifecycle management and simplifies parallel processing. This is huge for backend services needing concurrency without chaos â€” perfect fit for services deployed via AWS Lambda, ECS, or EKS.ğŸ§± How this strengthens Hexagonal Architecture and DDDJava 24â€™s cleaner syntax and enhanced language constructs allow for: ğŸ”¹ Richer domain modeling without ceremony ğŸ”¹ Easier testing and mocking of application ports ğŸ”¹ Clearer separation of concerns in inbound/outbound adapters ğŸ”¹ Better observability and tracing when paired with AWS services like CloudWatch & X-Rayâ˜ï¸ AWS + Java 24 = Cloud-native powerCombined with AWS, Java 24 enables: âœ… Lighter Lambda functions (faster cold starts with JDK optimizations) âœ… Enhanced developer productivity with CodeWhisperer and Amazon Q Developer âœ… Seamless integration with infrastructure-as-code (CDK, Terraform) and microservices ecosystemsWeâ€™re not just writing code â€” weâ€™re building resilient, scalable ecosystems. Java 24 gives us sharper tools to do that smarter, faster, and cleaner.Are you already experimenting with Java 24? Whatâ€™s your favorite improvement so far?hashtag#Java24 hashtag#HexagonalArchitecture hashtag#DDD hashtag#SoftwareArchitecture hashtag#AWS hashtag#CloudNative hashtag#Innovation hashtag#BackendEngineering hashtag#Leadership hashtag#LinkedInInsiderBR

Why Rate Limiting is Critical in Backend Systems Have you ever thought about what happens if a single user keeps sending repeated requests to a backend server?It may seem harmless at first â€” just one user refreshing the page. But in reality, this can lead to:ğŸš§ Unnecessary load on the serverğŸ§  Poor resource utilizationğŸ¢ Increased response time for other usersâŒ System becoming inaccessible or even crashing in extreme casesThat's where Rate Limiting comes in.What is Rate Limiting?Rate Limiting is a technique used to control how many requests a user can make to the server within a specific time frame.It ensures:Fair usageProtection against abuseBetter server health & performanceIn most cases, we apply rate limiting based on the userâ€™s IP address. For example:If a user hits the server more than 5 times in a short window (say 10 seconds), we either block the requests temporarily or slow them down.ğŸ§  My Approach: Redis-Based IP Rate LimitingHere's the flow I implemented:âœ… Accept incoming request from userğŸ” Check if userâ€™s IP is in RedisğŸ“ˆ If present, get the current count:If count > limit (e.g., 5): âŒ Send 429 Too Many Requests responseElse: ğŸ”„ Increment the countğŸ†• If not present:Set IP count to 1 with an expiry of 10 secondsğŸ” After 10 seconds, the counter auto-resets TTL

If youâ€™re new to drafting contracts, here are some tips that will help you avoid some costly mistakes.When it comes to writing contracts, clarity and conciseness rule the day. A poorly drafted contract can not only confuse the parties as to what is expected from whom, but it can also become a litigation quagmire if a later disagreement over the terms results in a lawsuit.Writing contracts and agreements require a meticulous approach. Begin with a clear title and an introduction that identifies the parties and purpose.Define key terms, specify obligations, and outline payment terms, if applicable. Include the contractâ€™s duration, termination conditions, performance standards, and, when necessary, provisions for confidentiality and intellectual property.Clarify liability, indemnification, and the process for dispute resolution, specifying governing law and jurisdiction. Address how amendments will be made, include an entire agreement clause, and outline severability.Provide space for all partiesâ€™ signatures and comply with any notary or witness requirements. Attach relevant documents and have legal counsel review them. Keep copies for reference. Customization is essential, and legal advice is recommended for complex contracts.

welcome back Ø¹Ø¯Ù†Ø§ Ø¨Ø¹Ø¯ Ø§Ù„ØºÙŠØ¨Ø© ğŸ˜… ğŸš€ Next Step: SWE.2 â€“ From Requirement to Architecture and Model! ğŸš€Iâ€™m thrilled to share the next phase of my MBD diploma project from OS-Academy â€“ : SWE.2 â€“ Software Architecture Design! ğŸš€In this stage, weâ€™ll take the system requirements defined in SWE.1 and build a modular, maintainable architecture that steers implementation, testing, and future evolution.Hereâ€™s what to expect:1ï¸âƒ£ Architectural Views Break the system into clear functional blocks and define their responsibilities:ğŸ”¹Main State Machine Manages core logic and coordinates inter-module communication.ğŸ”¹Current Limits Calculator Computes safe charge/discharge thresholds based on real-time data.ğŸ”¹SOC & SOH Estimators Tracks battery state-of-charge and state-of-health.ğŸ”¹Balancing Logic Ensures individual cell voltages stay synchronized.2ï¸âƒ£ Interfaces & Data FlowsMap each domain into software modules/packages with precise contracts: ğŸ”¹ Defined fixed-rate tasks(50 ms â” MainSM, 100 ms â” LimitsCalc, 200 ms â” SOC/SOH estimators, 250 ms â” Balancing) ğŸ”¹ Route signals (voltage, temperature, current) via buses and ZOH blocks ğŸ”¹ Store each signal in the Data Dictionary as ğŸ”„ a MTP Signals: (ImportedExtern (inputs) - ExportedToFile (logging) - Localized (module-internal))3ï¸âƒ£ Modeling & PrototypingLeverage MATLAB/Simulink & Stateflow to:ğŸ”¹Prototype each core module and simulate their interactions.ğŸ”¹Auto-generate architecture diagrams directly from models.ğŸ”¹Run Model Advisor checks for MISRA C compliance, execution efficiency, and RAM usage.4ï¸âƒ£ Verification AlignmentEmbed test hooks and traceability throughout:ğŸ”¹MIL/SIL Test Harnesses for unit, integration, and system-level validation.ğŸ”¹Full Requirements â†” Architecture â†” Test Case traceability matrices.ğŸ”¹Automated test-management reports to track coverage and results.ğŸ” Why it matters A well-crafted software architecture is the backbone of a reliable project â€”it makes implementation easier to develop, verify, and evolve. GCC15 is out, with prime path coverage! I wrote a paper about the my implementation, the algorithm, and some new developments; notably, that prime path coverage subsumes MC/DC, and that using suffix trees for recording paths can eliminate redundant paths very quickly -- O(nÂ²m) down from O(nÂ²mÂ²), where n is the length of the longest path, and m is the number of paths. This is makes pruning redundant paths very quick as n tends to be small, and m tends to be very large.

Up until recently Amethyst Planner stored everything locally on the user's device. Unfortunately this meant that the user couldn't use the app across multiple devices (or easy switch to a new device).I was surprised to find there wasn't an existing plugin for sync'ing data between Hive and a backend API. We ended up creating TimestampedBox that wraps a Hive Box and provides all the timestamps to support the sync operation. What do you think? When a request is made (e.g., POST /api/products), the flow goes as follows:1. The API Gateway forwards the request to the Auth Service to validate the JWT.2. if valid, it responds with a 200 OK.3. The Gateway then delegates the request to the appropriate microservice (e.g., Product Catalog).4. Then service checks user permissions and performs the necessary action.This approach ensures that each service remains focused on its core responsibilities while the gateway handles routing and initial auth validation.hashtag#Microservices hashtag#Authentication hashtag#APIGateway hashtag#Security hashtag#SoftwareArchitecture hashtag#backend hashtag#dotnet hashtag#csharp hashtag#nginx

Java 24: More than an update â€” a powerful step forward for modern software architecture. hashtag#LinkedInInsiderBRWith the official release of Java 24, Oracle continues to evolve the platform in ways that directly support today's demands for scalability, modularity, and cloud-native design. For professionals like me who architect systems with Hexagonal Architecture (DDD) and deploy on AWS, this release brings substantial benefits.ğŸš€ Key Features in Java 24:âœ… JEP 447 â€“ Statements before super(...) Allows initialization logic before calling the superclass constructor. This enhances flexibility in rich domain models and simplifies base-class inheritance patterns in DDD.âœ… JEP 456 â€“ Unnamed Variables and Patterns (Preview) Reduces boilerplate when using pattern matching, making business logic cleaner and more expressive.âœ… JEP 459 â€“ String Templates (Second Preview) Provides safe and efficient string interpolation â€” ideal for building dynamic responses, configurations, and messages without complex concatenation.âœ… JEP 460 â€“ Vector API (7th Incubator) Enables data-parallel operations for better performance in compute-heavy tasks â€” relevant for analytics or event-driven systems.âœ… JEP 462 â€“ Structured Concurrency (Second Preview) Improves thread lifecycle management and simplifies parallel processing. This is huge for backend services needing concurrency without chaos â€” perfect fit for services deployed via AWS Lambda, ECS, or EKS.ğŸ§± How this strengthens Hexagonal Architecture and DDDJava 24â€™s cleaner syntax and enhanced language constructs allow for: ğŸ”¹ Richer domain modeling without ceremony ğŸ”¹ Easier testing and mocking of application ports ğŸ”¹ Clearer separation of concerns in inbound/outbound adapters ğŸ”¹ Better observability and tracing when paired with AWS services like CloudWatch & X-Rayâ˜ï¸ AWS + Java 24 = Cloud-native powerCombined with AWS, Java 24 enables: âœ… Lighter Lambda functions (faster cold starts with JDK optimizations) âœ… Enhanced developer productivity with CodeWhisperer and Amazon Q Developer âœ… Seamless integration with infrastructure-as-code (CDK, Terraform) and microservices ecosystemsWeâ€™re not just writing code â€” weâ€™re building resilient, scalable ecosystems. Java 24 gives us sharper tools to do that smarter, faster, and cleaner.Are you already experimenting with Java 24? Whatâ€™s your favorite improvement so far?hashtag#Java24 hashtag#HexagonalArchitecture hashtag#DDD hashtag#SoftwareArchitecture hashtag#AWS hashtag#CloudNative hashtag#Innovation hashtag#BackendEngineering hashtag#Leadership hashtag#LinkedInInsiderBR

Why Rate Limiting is Critical in Backend Systems Have you ever thought about what happens if a single user keeps sending repeated requests to a backend server?It may seem harmless at first â€” just one user refreshing the page. But in reality, this can lead to:ğŸš§ Unnecessary load on the serverğŸ§  Poor resource utilizationğŸ¢ Increased response time for other usersâŒ System becoming inaccessible or even crashing in extreme casesThat's where Rate Limiting comes in.What is Rate Limiting?Rate Limiting is a technique used to control how many requests a user can make to the server within a specific time frame.It ensures:Fair usageProtection against abuseBetter server health & performanceIn most cases, we apply rate limiting based on the userâ€™s IP address. For example:If a user hits the server more than 5 times in a short window (say 10 seconds), we either block the requests temporarily or slow them down.ğŸ§  My Approach: Redis-Based IP Rate LimitingHere's the flow I implemented:âœ… Accept incoming request from userğŸ” Check if userâ€™s IP is in RedisğŸ“ˆ If present, get the current count:If count > limit (e.g., 5): âŒ Send 429 Too Many Requests responseElse: ğŸ”„ Increment the countğŸ†• If not present:Set IP count to 1 with an expiry of 10 secondsğŸ” After 10 seconds, the counter auto-resets TTL
